fact: The first computer virus was created in 1986 and was called Brain.
Python is named after 'Monty Python', not the snake.
The first website ever created is still online: http://info.cern.ch
The first mouse prototype was made of wood in 1964 by Douglas Engelbart.
NASA's Mars Rover, Perseverance, runs on a PowerPC 750 processor—the same as an old iMac G3.
Google was originally called 'Backrub' before being renamed in 1997.
The first email was sent by Ray Tomlinson to himself in 1971.
Elon Musk's Tesla Roadster, launched into space, is expected to orbit the Sun for millions of years.
Amazon was originally called 'Cadabra', but was changed because it sounded like 'Cadaver'.
The first smartphone was made in 1992 by IBM. It was called 'Simon' and had a touchscreen.
Bill Gates wrote a tic-tac-toe game in BASIC as one of his first programs.
The world's first 1GB hard drive was introduced by IBM in 1980. It weighed over 500 pounds.
Java was originally designed for interactive television, but it was too advanced for cable TV in 1991.
The HotSpot JVM uses 'escape analysis' to eliminate unnecessary object allocations and make heap usage more efficient.
The term 'Java bytecode' is misleading because it doesn’t correspond to bytes; some instructions are longer than one byte.
The earliest versions of Java had built-in support for IPv6 before many operating systems fully adopted it.
The Java compiler is written in Java itself, making it a self-hosting compiler.
Java supports method overloading based on the number, type, and order of parameters, but not based on the return type alone.
The 'volatile' keyword in Java does not make a variable atomic; it only ensures visibility of changes to multiple threads.
The JIT compiler in the JVM can inline methods at runtime, even those that were originally marked as 'virtual'.
Java has a hidden 'Unsafe' class that allows direct memory manipulation, much like C/C++ pointers.
Even though Java has automatic garbage collection, memory leaks are still possible due to improper handling of references.
Java's 'String' class is immutable, but the JVM internally optimizes string concatenation to avoid excessive object creation.
The Java Virtual Machine (JVM) specification allows multiple different implementations, such as OpenJDK, GraalVM, and Azul Zing.
NullPointerException (NPE) is one of the most common runtime errors in Java, and Java 14 introduced helpful NPE messages to make debugging easier.
The 'transient' keyword in Java prevents a field from being serialized, which is useful for security-sensitive data.
In Java, 'Integer.valueOf()' caches values between -128 and 127 to improve performance and reduce memory usage.
The term 'bug' in computing originated when a real moth was found causing issues in a Mark II computer in 1947.
Dennis Ritchie, the creator of the C programming language, also co-developed the UNIX operating system.
The Linux kernel was first released by Linus Torvalds in 1991 as a hobby project.
The original iPhone had more computing power than NASA’s Apollo 11 spacecraft.
Git, the version control system, was created by Linus Torvalds in 2005 to manage Linux kernel development.
The first webcam was used at Cambridge University to monitor a coffee pot.
CAPTCHA stands for 'Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart'.
Ctrl + Alt + Delete was originally used by developers to reboot IBM PCs during system crashes.
Y2K was feared to crash computers worldwide, but thanks to years of effort, the impact was minimal.
Ada Lovelace is considered the first computer programmer, writing an algorithm in the mid-1800s for Charles Babbage’s Analytical Engine.
